solution_line_template: If Lou runs {lou_miles_run} miles during his workout on a track that is {track_length} miles long, then he circles the track {lou_miles_run}/({track_length})={lou_circles} times.

If Rosie runs twice as fast as Lou, then over the same time period, she runs {lou_miles_run}*{rosie_speed_multiplier}=<<{lou_miles_run}*{rosie_speed_multiplier}={rosie_miles_run}>>{rosie_miles_run} miles.

If Rosie runs {rosie_miles_run} miles on the {track_length} mile track, then she circles the track {rosie_miles_run}/({track_length})=<<{rosie_miles_run}/({track_length})={rosie_circles}>>{rosie_circles} times.
